ANU.name: James Webb
expertise: Microwave And Millimetrewave Theory And Technology
ANU.biography: Upon returning to Australia, Dr Webb resumed consulting in the areas of medical product development and applied electromagnetics for Defence while employed as an R&D engineer in the field of high accuracy radionavigation.  In 2015 he led the image processing and real-time laser and telescope control system efforts for an SSA research consortium while playing key engineering roles in the construction of an observatory in Western Australia.  He is currently focussed on the creation of optical SSA sensors and free space quantum optical laser communication systems.

ANDS-Grants.description: Poor water quality affects many rivers and receiving waters such as the Great Barrier Reef and Gippsland Lakes. This project will use Bayesian Heirarcical models of state-wide water quality data to quanitfy the effects of a range of factors on stream water quality including climate, landuse, river flow, vegetation cover, etc. The analysis will extract information from the entire data set rather than concentrating on individual sites. It will underpin a new predictive capacity including response to land use and management changes and climatic variations based on long-term data sets, as well as a water quality prediction capability. The models developed will jointly model a range of inter-related water quality parameters.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP140100495
subjects: CATCHMENT WATER QUALITY; CATCHMENT WATER QUALITY; SPATIAL ANALYSIS; SPATIAL ANALYSIS; STATISTICAL DATA ANALYSIS; STATISTICAL DATA ANALYSIS; STATISTICAL DATA ANALYSIS
